## Description
The **Normalizer **operator allows to select the format of the address returned in output.

> Important

The operator is only available for projects created on installations of the Data Transformation software service within Doxee environments.

## Input
**Input**

**Data type**

**Description**

**address**

String

Street name and number

**zipcode**

Variable

ZIP code

**province**

String

Province / county

**city**

String

City

## **Output**
**Output**

**Data type**

**Description**

**out0**

String

Information about the four fixed input fields and any additional parameters configured by the user in the settings

> Important

All input fields are mandatory.

## Settings
![](data:image/png;base64,)

- In the **Fields **section, click  ![](data:image/png;base64,) (**Add**) to add an address field to the list.

A new field is added to the list:

![](data:image/png;base64,)

- From the **Result Code **drop-down menu, select the field that you want to use for the **out0 **output. The available options are:

**Result Code**: Can be one of the following:

**0**: Address already normalized

- **6**: Address normalized by the operator

- **8**: Address not normalized

- **Full Address**

- **Dug**

- **Short Address**

- **Long Address**

- **Street Number**

- **Zip Code**

- **City**

- **Province**

- **Province Abbreviation**

- **District**

- **Town**

- **Error Code**

- **Error Type**

- **Error Description**

- Repeat steps 1â€“2 to add as many fields as required for the **out0 **output.

- In the **Separator **section, select the character that you want to use to separate the fields. The available options are:

**,**

- **;**

- **:**

- **|**

- **"**

- **-**

- **_**

- **+**

- **#**

- #### *(empty space)*

> Tip

Click ![](data:image/png;base64,) 	(**Add item**) at the bottom of the drop-down menu to add a custom value to the list, then click ![](data:image/png;base64,) to confirm.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

- Click **Apply **to confirm.

> Tip

To rename a field, click on its name to edit it.

To remove a field from the list, move your mouse over it and click ![](data:image/png;base64,) in the **Action **column; for example:

![](data:image/png;base64,)

## Special cases
In special cases, the operator behaves as follows:

**Case**

**Behavior**

**NULL input (no input)**

The operator returns an empty string. The system logs a warning event.
